t: Why Are You Cast Down, O My Soul?
To the choirmaster. A Maskil of the Sons of Korah.
As*pn a deer pants for flowing streams, so*ld pants my soul for you, O God.
My*ln soul thirsts for God, for*ld the living God. When*ln shall I come and appear before God?
My*ln tears have been my food day*ld and night, while*ln they say to me all the day long, “Where*ld is your God?”

These*ln things I remember, as*ld I pour out my soul: how*ln I would go with the throng and*ld lead them in procession to the house of God with*ln glad shouts and songs of praise, a*ld multitude keeping festival.
Why*pn are you cast down, O my soul, and*ld why are you in turmoil within me? Hope*ln in God; for I shall again praise him, my*ld salvation
and my God. My*pn soul is cast down within me; therefore*ld I remember you from*ln the land of Jordan and of Hermon, from*ld Mount Mizar.
Deep*ln calls to deep at*ld the roar of your waterfalls; all*ln your breakers and your waves have*ld gone over me.
By*ln day the Lord*s commands his steadfast love, and*ld at night his song is with me, a*ld prayer to the God of my life.
I*ln say to God, my rock: “Why*ld have you forgotten me? Why*ln do I go mourning because*ld of the oppression of the enemy?”
As*ln with a deadly wound in my bones, my*ld adversaries taunt me, while*ln they say to me all the day long, “Where*ld is your God?”
Why*pn are you cast down, O my soul, and*ld why are you in turmoil within me? Hope*ln in God; for I shall again praise him, my*ld salvation and my God.
